eventemitter

Class EventEmitter<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eventemitter.EventEmitter<E>

  • public class EventEmitter<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    A very simple implementation of an event emitter, made to use Java's lambda expressions extensively.

    Is thread safe.

    Is also exception safe as all exception occurring in consumers are redirected to an uncaught exception handler.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventEmitter()
      Constructs an event emitter with an exception handler redirecting to `Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()` if it is defined.
      EventEmitter(java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler ueh_)
      Constructs an event emitter by specifying the exception handler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventEmitter

        public EventEmitter()
        Constructs an event emitter with an exception handler redirecting to `Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()` if it is defined. If is is not defined the exceptions will be ignored.

      • EventEmitter

        public EventEmitter(@NonNull
                    java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler ueh_)
        Constructs an event emitter by specifying the exception handler.
        Parameters:
        ueh_ - The exception handler

    • Method Detail

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
        Adds a consumer to the list of consumers.
        Parameters:
        c - The consumer

      • removeConsumer

        public void removeConsumer(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
        Removes a consumer from the list consumers. If the consumer is not found in the list this operation has no effect.
        Parameters:
        c - The consumer

      • trigger

        public void trigger(E arg)
        Triggers all consumers with the specified argument.

        Any exception occurring in a consumer will be redirected to the uncaught exception handler.

        A copy of the consumers list is created before invoking them. This allows the list to be mutated during event triggering.

        Parameters:
        arg - The argument

      • getUncaughtExceptionHandler

        public java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
        The uncaught exception handler. It is used whenever an exception is thrown in one of the consumers.

        Note that the uncaught exception handler should never throw exceptions. If that happens anyway the exception will be ignored.
